thread.title: Prima ballerina Tan Yuan Yuan hired to give inside travel tips to Rosewood Hotels and Resorts
thread.title_full: Prima ballerina Tan Yuan Yuan hired to give inside travel tips to Rosewood Hotels and Resorts

author: eTN Managing Editor
title: Prima ballerina Tan Yuan Yuan hired to give inside travel tips to Rosewood Hotels and Resorts
text:
Prima ballerina Tan Yuan Yuan hired to give inside travel tips to Rosewood Hotels and Resorts   
Aug 13, 2015 Banners   
China's prima ballerina Tan Yuan Yuan has joined Rosewood Hotels & Resorts® “Rosewood Curators” as the Beijing advisor, joining a carefully selected group of luminaries and leaders sharing insider secrets, travel tips and favorite activities in Rosewood destinations around the world. 
Hailed as one of the most outstanding ballerinas of our time, and certainly the most famous from mainland China, Yuan Yuan has been principal dancer of the San Francisco Ballet for 20 years. Through her 130 performances per year, from classical ballet to modern dance, she manages to keep a foot in the worlds of East and West, celebrating the best of both. 
Named one of "Asia's Heroes" by Time magazine in 2004, she also received the Excellence Award from The Committee of 100, an elite organization of distinguished Chinese Americans in 2010. In addition to multiple accolades in dance, she featured in an international GAP ad campaign in 2012 and has been photographed for both Vogue and W magazines. 
“Because I’m an artist myself, the reason I like Beijing so much is that the people are very creative and open to anything. Creativity draws my attention and inspires me,” says Yuan Yuan. “The ancient and the modern co-exist in Beijing. It is fascinating – anything you can imagine, anything you can think of, is here.” 
The ultra-luxury hotel group launched its innovative Rosewood Curators programme in 2013. More than 20 Rosewood Curators worldwide include fashion editor Nina Garcia, film director Johnnie To and top auctioneer Simon de Pury.
